Class Board

java.lang.Object
Board
All Implemented Interfaces:
Constants
public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
implements Constants
Provides a text-based game board for the "tic-tac-toe" game, and enables adding marks while providing methods to the game board and methods to check if any Player object has reached a win or tie situation.
Since:
Oct 19, 2020
Version:
2.0
Author:
Scott Tianhan Jiang

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    (package private) void addHyphens()
    Prints out 3 horizontal lines with hyphens.
    void addMark​(int row, int col, char mark)
    Adds marks passed from arguments to the specific cell of theBoard object, and increment the mark count.

    Prints out 3 vertical lines with "|".

    The algorithm that checks if the argument mark is the winner.
    void clear()
    Resets game board content, replace all existing marks with space character and reset the mark count parameter to 0.

    Prints out the entire 3 row X 3 column game board with X and/or O marks.

    • theBoard

      private char[][] theBoard

    • markCount

      private int markCount

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board()

  • Method Details

    • getMark

      public char getMark​(int row, int col)
      Checks and returns the mark in current cell.
      Parameters:
      row - represents the row number
      col - represents the column number
      Returns:
      the mark as X, O or blank space in the current cell

    • isFull

      public boolean isFull()
      Indicates the current fullness status of the board with a boolean value.
      Returns:
      yes if full, no if not full.

    • xWins

      public boolean xWins()
      Checks if player X wins.
      Returns:
      yes if X wins, no if O wins.

    • oWins

      public boolean oWins()
      Checks if player O wins.
      Returns:
      yes if O wins, no if X wins.

    • display

      public void display()
      Prints out the entire 3 row X 3 column game board with X and/or O marks.

    • addMark

      public void addMark​(int row, int col, char mark)
      Adds marks passed from arguments to the specific cell of theBoard object, and increment the mark count.
      Parameters:
      row - represents the row number
      col - represents the column number
      mark - is the parameter with value of X or O

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Resets game board content, replace all existing marks with space character and reset the mark count parameter to 0.

    • checkWinner

      int checkWinner​(char mark)
      The algorithm that checks if the argument mark is the winner.
      Parameters:
      mark - with value X or O
      Returns:
      integer number 0 or 1, representing not win and win, respectively.

    • displayColumnHeaders

      void displayColumnHeaders()
      Prints out 3 column headers

    • addHyphens

      void addHyphens()
      Prints out 3 horizontal lines with hyphens.

    • addSpaces

      void addSpaces()
      Prints out 3 vertical lines with "|".
